articles.title: Preparatory Committee Formed
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee Formed 
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The Association for Friendship with the Korean People which has its branches in more than 90 countries formed a preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun on March 3.
 Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee and Bjonar Simonsen, representative of the Norway Branch of the association, secretary of the committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to open Internet special homepage on the occasion of the Day of the Sun to carry articles praising the undying revolutionary exploits of President  Kim Il Sung and hold a Korean film show and photo exhibition.

articles.title: Drug Smuggling Increases in S. Korea
articles.content:
Drug Smuggling Increases in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Drug smuggling is now rapidly increasing in south Korea, according to south Korean MBC.
 10 cases of drug smuggling were detected at Inchon airport this year, which increased by 40 percent as compared with those in the same period of last year.
 Philopon seized accounts for over 1,290 million won in domestic currency, or more than 15 times that of last year.

articles.title: U.S. Denounced for Aggravating Tensions
Withdrawal of Agreement on Reshaping S. Korea-U.S Alliance Demanded
articles.content:
Withdrawal of Agreement on Reshaping S. Korea-U.S Alliance Demanded 
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Over 140 civic and social organizations including the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society reportedly held a "news conference of civic organizations urging the withdrawal of the agreement on reshaping the south Korea-U.S. alliance" in Seoul on March 9.
 Noting that the United States and the south Korean authorities were holding a series of negotiations in camera on the effectuation of the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. forces, relocation of U.S. military bases, purification of the polluted U.S. bases to be returned to south Korea and other issues, the speakers said these negotiations were premised on the reorganization of the   shackling and aggressive military "alliance".
 They denounced the humiliating submission of the "government" to the U.S. in accepting the unilateral demands of the U.S. root and branch at the closed-door negotiations which would drive the people to death.    
 They demanded a prompt abolition of the unequal south Korea-U.S. "alliance," noting that it is wholly used as a tool for realizing the U.S. strategy for world supremacy.
 The press release demanded the "government" totally nullify the results of the humiliating negotiations with the U.S. and immediately retract the agreement on reshaping the "alliance".

articles.title: Joint Struggle for Defending Cultural Sovereignty Declared
articles.content:
Joint Struggle for Defending Cultural Sovereignty Declared 
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Thirty cultural and art organizations of south Korea reportedly called a news conference in Seoul on March 9 and declared the formation of the Culture and Art Joint Measure Committee for Checking the South Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement and Securing Cultural Variety.
 Kim Yong Thae, co-permanent representative of the committee, and other speakers said the committee would wage an intensive fight against the authorities' decision on the reduction of the screen quota and the negotiation for the signing of a "free trade agreement" in solidarity with organizations of various circles. 
 A press release was made public at the end of the news conference.
 Denouncing the government for seeking to totally sell out the culture of south Korean society through the conclusion of a humiliating south Korean-U.S. free trade agreement, the release urged the authorities to stop the negotiation for the signing of the agreement and repeal the decision on reduction of the screen quota.

articles.title: Immediate Cancellation of Plan for Joint Military Exercises Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Immediate Cancellation of Plan for Joint Military Exercises Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The National People's Solidarity of south Korea reportedly issued a statement on March 10 demanding the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" immediately cancel its plan to stage joint war maneuvers, a combination of RSOI and Foal Eagle, from March 25 to 31.  
 These large-scale war exercises will be U.S.-led saber rattling for aggression to be staged on the Korean Peninsula, the statement noted, and continued:
 It is a quite objective and natural conclusion that the above-said exercises will be war maneuvers to invade the north and a dangerous move to escalate the stand-off and spark a war crisis on the Korean Peninsula every year.    
 The projected military exercises are fraught with increasing danger as they are slated to take place at a time when the flexibility for aggression of the U.S. forces in south Korea is openly justified by the agreement on consenting to their "strategic flexibility." 
 We can never recognize the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. forces in south Korea and their redeployment intended to turn the Korean Peninsula into a base for a war against the north and a base for aggression aimed at holding military supremacy in Northeast Asia and the U.S. move to turn them into "rapid deployment forces" nor can we tolerate large-scale war maneuvers for invasion of the north to be openly staged under the pretext of "joint exercises".

2nd International Martial Arts Games to Be Held
articles.content:
2nd International Martial Arts Games to Be Held
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The 2nd International Martial Arts Games will be held from August 22 to 29 in Pyongyang amid great expectation and interest of the Korean people and martial art players. 
 It will be attended by players from the DPRK and tens of countries. 
 The games will include Taekwon-Do, the orthodox martial art in Korea, wushu, Karate, Paduk(go) and Ssirum(Korean wrestling) and demonstration and exhibition shows of national martial arts of the various countries.    
 Its first games were held in the DPRK in September Juche 93 (2004).
 They, the first of their kind in history, were a significant festival in which some 400 martial art players and representatives from over 40 countries including China, Japan, Germany and UK got together and demonstrated their noble sportsmanship and high degree of martial arts technique.    
 The organizing committee for the 2nd International Martial Arts Games has already been formed and its panels buckled down to the preparatory work.
